column5: This is truly a sad day Rock and Roll and music has lost a truly unique bass player, artist and gentleman.  EVERYTHING LOUDER THEN EVERYTHING ELSE  Long Live Lemmy!!!!!!!!!  My condolences to his band mates and Crew
Thought it a bad joke when I read the news last night.
Rest in peace, I got to see them play in Montreal a couple years ago, glad I was able to

Motorhead's music has been with me through it all since I was a little kid. He was the true rock n roll preacher, the real deal to the bone. 40 years of Motorhead, 20+ albums and not a bad song to be found. Still pretty upset over this, but the fact that he made it to 70 and was still touring around the world in the final months of his life after his health had already taken a few downturns should speak volumes about his character!
